ARABIC: وَلَئِنْ أَطَعْتُم بَشَرًا مِّثْلَكُمْ إِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّخَٰسِرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If you were to obey a human being like yourselves, you would, in that case, definitely be the losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So if you follow a man like yourself you will certainly be doomed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: If you were to obey a human being like yourselves, you will certainly be losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: If you follow a mortal like yourselves you will certainly be lost.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “If you were to obey a human like yourselves, then surely you are losers!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: If you were to obey a human being like yourselves, then verily, you indeed would be losers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And if you obey a mortal like yourselves, then most surely you will be losers:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: If you obey a mortal like yourselves, then you will be losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: If ye were to obey a mortal like yourselves, then, lo! ye surely would be losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: if you obey a human being just like yourselves, then you will surely be lost.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And were ye to obey a human being like you, ye are forthwith to be losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: If you obey a human being like yourselves, you will indeed be losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: If ye obey a man like yourselves, behold, it is certain ye will be lost.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: If you were to obey a human being like yourselves, then verily! You indeed would be losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: If you obey a mortal like yourselves, you shall be lost.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: If you obey a human being like yourselves, then you will be losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And if you should obey a man like yourselves, indeed, you would then be losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:34] And, by God, if you obey a human being like yourselves (this [clause] contains both an oath and a conditional; the response belongs to the former [the oath], which [at the same time] suffices in place of a response for the latter [the conditional]) you will surely then, that is, should you obey them, be losers, you will have been duped.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (If ye were to obey a mortal) a human being (like yourselves, ye surely would be losers) you would be ignorant and losers.
